title: Lewis Fiorini
text:
Lewis Fiorini (born 17 May 2002) is a professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who currently plays as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> for <a href="Lincoln%20City%20F.C.">Lincoln City</a>, on loan from <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City</a>. Born in England and of Italian descent, Fiorini represents Scotland at youth international level.
Club career.
Manchester City.
A skilful attacking midfielder, Fiorini has been at <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City</a> for more than a decade and has progressed through several age groups. On the 2 July 2021, he signed a new long-term contract at the club, keeping him at Manchester City until the summer of 2026.
NAC Brada (loan).
On 20 August 2020, Fiorini joined <a href="NAC%20Breda">NAC Breda</a> on a season-long loan. Over the loan spell he scored six goals and get five assists.
Lincoln City (loan).
On 2 July 2021, Fiorini signed a season-long loan at <a href="Lincoln%20City%20F.C.">Lincoln City</a>, admitting that he spoke with Manchester City teammate and ex-Lincoln City loanne <a href="Morgan%20Rogers">Morgan Rogers</a> about joining the club. He made his debut on the 10 August, coming off the bench in an <a href="EFL%20Cup">EFL Cup</a> tie against <a href="Shrewsbury%20Town%20F.C.">Shrewsbury Town</a> which saw the Imps lose on penalties, with Fiorini missing their final one. He scored his first goal for the club, during a 5-1 victory against <a href="Cambridge%20United%20F.C.">Cambridge United</a> on 11 September 2021, a spectacular effort from the edge of the </ref>
